entry.title: authentication_service.mm is missing build dependency to /ios/chrome/browser/sync/model
entry.content:
The ios file ios/chrome/browser/signin/model/authentication_service.mm includes ios/chrome/browser/sync/model/sync_setup_service.h but the build target does not depend on ios/chrome/browser/sync/model.
Not declaring this dependency prevents seemingly unrelated code changes from landing, usually due to linker errors.
Adding the dependency is non-trivial because it would otherwise create a circular dependency.
One possible solution could be to move AuthenticationService to a dedicated build target.

entry.title: Missing build dep in /ios/chrome/browser/history/model
entry.content:
/ios/chrome/browser/history/model:model should depend in /ios/chrome/browser/sync/model because ios/chrome/browser/history/model/web_history_service_factory.cc includes ios/chrome/browser/sync/model/sync_service_factory.h.
Not declaring this dependency prevents seemingly unrelated code changes from landing, usually due to linker errors.
Adding the dependency is non-trivial because it would otherwise create a circular dependency.
Assigning tentatively to sczs@, only listed owner.

entry.title: Emscripten-compiled WebGPU example has started to AwwSnap.
entry.content:
The attached WebGPU sample deterministically causes an Aww, Snap dialog on my Chrome, but it didn't do that before.
To run, spin up an ad hoc web server and visit buffer_map_sync.html.
It may be possible that the code does something wrong, although some months ago it used to work. Even if this is a case of bad code, I'm hoping that it should not at least fail to Chrome tab crashing.
The code is compiled from the following source code: https://github.com/juj/wasm_webgpu/blob/main/samples/buffer_map_sync/buffer_map_sync.c

entry.title: Non-Regression: Unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay when 'On-Screen Keyboard' is enabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 121.0.6167.188/15699.66.0 Stable-channel on Bobba(Octopus) device Lacros Version: LaCrOS Canary #123.0.6304.0[LaCrOS Only] OS: Chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Test account and Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes, enrolled with Corp account 3)Devices: ANon-Corp device Lava(Coral) - X86/lacros64 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: Yes( 121.0.6167.188/15699.66.0) 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Launch Lacros -> Open multiple tabs(more than 8) and close few tabs(4-5) (2) Now enable 'On-Screen Keyboard' from Accessibility menyu at Uber Tray (3)Open NTP and observe virtual keyboard gets popped up -> now click on 'Search tabs' (4)Scroll down and observe unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' (Please refer Video)
Expected: Should be able to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay Actual: Instead unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay
This is Non-Regression issue seen from M111 #111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 stable-channel on Lava(Coral) device

entry.title: Proxy auth not working in Chrome for Mac Book
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome 2. Search for a website
# Problem Description We have a basic proxy authentication with credentials from kerberos ad. The macbook is connected and working well in active directory, the only issue we have is that Chrome is asking the user everytime he accesses a website the username and password for proxy authentication. All our macs have this issue. I cannot understand why it does not pass them automatically because also the user logged into the mac is from active directory.
# Additional Comments We have also put credentials for proxy into the system keychain
# Summary Proxy auth not working in Chrome for Mac Book
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Chrome perf graphs and pinpoint disagree
entry.content:
We've been using the chrome perf graphs to continuously track performance on benchmarks. We're also using pinpoint to evaluate potential improvements.
We've always assumed that what we see on pinpoint should mostly match what we later get on the graphs once a CL lands. Although we know not to expect an exact match, I've recently learned that the disparity between perf graphs and pinpoint is match worse than expected.
I've been specifically evaluating the perf of a V8 feature called MinorMS (which is enabled on field trial). To do that I compare, for example, the perf graphs for Speedometer2 (which runs with the MinorMS feature enabled) against the graph for Speedometer2-nominorms (which uses the same configuration as Speedometer2 but explicitly disables the MinorMS feature via --js-flags). You can see the graphs in [1] (skia UI) and [2] (legacy UI). The graphs claim that running with MinorMS regresses the benchmark score by ~1%.
However, if I run the same comparison on pinpoint (see [3] and [4], each with over 100 attempts to average out noise), I see that running with MinorMS improves the benchmarks by ~0.5%-0.8%.
This disparity is significant and completely changes the picture.
Obviously one of the results is wrong, but it is very much unclear to me which of them is the wrong one. At the moment, I find myself unable to trust either results and thus without any reliable way to evaluate the performance of our work.
[1] https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/e/?queries=benchmark%3Dspeedometer2%26bot%3Dlinux-perf%26master%3DChromiumPerf%26stat%3Dvalue%26subtest_1%3DSpeedometer2%26test%3DRunsPerMinute&queries=benchmark%3Dspeedometer2-nominorms%26bot%3Dlinux-perf%26master%3DChromiumPerf%26stat%3Dvalue%26subtest_1%3DSpeedometer2%26test%3DRunsPerMinute&requestType=0&selected=commit%3D1261284%26name%3D%252Cbenchmark%253Dspeedometer2-nominorms%252Cbot%253Dlinux-perf%252Cimprovement_direction%253Dup%252Cmaster%253DChromiumPerf%252Cstat%253Dvalue%252Csubtest_1%253DSpeedometer2%252Ctest%253DRunsPerMinute%252Cunit%253Dunitless_biggerIsBetter%252C&showZero=false&summary=true [2] https://chromeperf.appspot.com/report?sid=47385ad496521d3cdd0e8979faf60056a0d069b7ad81d1e9f181264966e402a1 [3] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/1275ca53ee0000 [4] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/11dc10afee0000

entry.title: Change DevTools waterfall rotation email
entry.content:
It seems that something broke since december with Gerrit sending emails to go/rotation oncalls.
DevTools uses devtools-waterfall-sheriff-onduty@grotations.appspotmail.com as the oncall email, but sheriffs no longer receive any email updates.
E.g we used to get emails for the devtools-internal -> Chromium roll (example CL: https://crrev.com/c/5299888)
In the go/rotation UI there is now an update that the `@rotations.google.com` suffix is preferred. Manually uploading CLs and adding the two mail addresses has confirmed that `@rotations.google.com` works, whereas the appspotmail doesn't.
We should update all existing usages of the appspotmail with the newer address. Priority-wise we should start with the roll CLs that require Sheriff review.

entry.title: Improve reusing `ShapeResult` while editing
entry.content:
We have two different ways to "reuse existing `ShapeResult`". This issue is for tracking reviews on the reuse for editing.
The first "reuse" is built in `InlineItemsBuilder`, which tries to use previous `InlineItem` and `ShapeResult` where it's safe and possible to reuse. This improves 2nd or later layouts.
The second "reuse" is for editing. While editing text, Blink internally uses functions in [`CharacterData`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CharacterData), such as `appendData`. In this case, text changes so it needs reshape, but we know how text changes, so there's an optimized code path to avoid marking `NeedsCollectInlines` for every character.
These edit operations go to [`InlineNode::SetTextWithOffset`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/inline/inline_node.cc;l=924?q=InlineNode::SetTextWithOffset&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) to adjust `InlineItem` and `ShapeResult` without fully reshaping. This type of reusing is implemented in `InlineNodeDataEditor` and `ReusingTextShaper`. In short, this runs `CollectInlines` and patches the `ShapeResult`.
One difficulty exists here, it's not very easy to use the knowledge of "how it's edited", because editing happens on DOM, while shaping needs to handle white-space collapsed text. To solve this difficulty, [`InlineNodeDataEditor::Run()`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/inline/inline_node.cc?q=InlineNodeDataEditor::Run&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) compares the two white-space collapsed text, before and after the edit.
This method has a different difficulty, because it's a simple string comparison to find a difference by `std::mismatch`, it may sometimes make a wrong guess, such as issue 40879986, as [discussed here](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5285603/comment/9250a5a1_0d2e4f14/).

entry.title: Encrypt Cookies used by the WebView
entry.content:
**Steps to reproduce**
When a WebView is used on Android the cookies are stored in plaintext in `/data/data/<app-name>/app_view/Default/Cookie`. Using the `CookieManager` class, it is possible to override certain methods to encrypt cookies before storing them on the device.
**Expected result**
When cookies are encrypted, the WebView should have a functionality to be able to decrypt them again. (For example, by passing it the required key material.)
**Actual result:**
The WebView is not able to decrypt the cookies.

entry.title: Upload to Google Photos fails if directory is renamed (macOS)
entry.content:
I was uploading a folder of 29 photos to Google Photos and renamed the source directory on my computer in the middle. The first 13 photos were successfully uploaded but the remaining 16 failed. I’m not entirely sure whether this is a bug in Google Photos or Chromium, but on macOS, applications are supposed to be able to handle files and directories being renamed while they’re open.
I am using Version 121.0.6167.184 (Official Build) (x86_64) on Sonoma 14.3.1.

entry.title: Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left.
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6300.3 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) 57295a4890d5d5f76872ed19abaf85a3c85876a6-refs/branch-heads/6300@{#9}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Right Click and then Inspect 3.Go to Element Tab 4.Drag the Styles Bar Towards Left side 6.Observe that, Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left.
Actual Result:Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left. Expected Result:Horizontal bar should be visible throughout the dragging it to left side.
This issue exists from M-113 onwards .So,raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached screencast link below: https://screenpal.com/watch/cZnD11VddUF
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable #122.0.6261.49, Beta #122.0.6261.6 and Dev RC#123.0.6300.3 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Regression: Profile icon is not loaded properly(Image is seen broken) for New tab page
entry.content:
Chrome Version: Ash-chrome M123 canary 123.0.6291.0/15779.0.0 on eve(poppy) device Lacros Version :lacros canary 123.0.6304.0 [lacros only] OS: chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Corp account and Test account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes, enrolled with Corp account 3)Devices: Non-corp device Eve(poppy) - X86/lacros 64 Babymega(coral) -x86/lacros 64 corp-device Dratini(Hatch) device -x86/lacros 64
4)Repro on Ash-chrome: yes
5)Mode: Device is in Verified mode
6)Frequency: Always
Enabled the lacros flags #lacros-stability = canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1)Launch Lacros 2) Try to open a NTP and observe the profile icon
What is the expected result? Profile icon should view properly
What happens instead? Observed Profile icon is not loaded properly(breakage of image is seen)
Note: 1)Issue observed on ash-chrome as well lacros 2)Checked connecting with LAN connection and wifi,but still image is seen broken 3)Tried restarting the device but still observed the same 4)Oserved issue only with the NTP(new tab page)
Issue seems to be regression,issue worked fine on M111 stable 111.0.5653.152/15329.63.0 on Lava(coral) device
Attaching listnr feedback report: https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565537802

Crash Type: Ill Crash Address: 0x59f7b2927744 Crash State: SkAbort_FileLine SkBitmap::allocPixels SkBitmap::allocPixels
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Crash Revision: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_media&revision=1232806
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6377015223975936
Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.

entry.title: Screenshot's initial position is incorrect
entry.content: Currently the initial position is (-W * 0.25 * 0.85, 0). It supposed to be (-W * 0.25, 0). Need to change how the progress is mapped in PhysicsModel. It's a minor change. ``` finger pos 0 -> W active page 0 -> 0.85W screenshot -0.25W -> 0 ```

entry.title: rust compile errors in rust roll
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5296403
e.g.
https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-chromeos-dbg/5192/overview
``` RUST obj/third_party/boringssl/bssl_crypto/libbssl_crypto_bssl_crypto.rlib python3 ../../build/rust/rustc_wrapper.py --rustc=../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/rustc --depfi...(too long) error: method `as_ffi_void_ptr` is never used --> ../../third_party/boringssl/src/rust/bssl-crypto/src/lib.rs:104:8 | 102 | trait FfiMutSlice { | ----------- method in this trait 103 | fn as_mut_ffi_ptr(&mut self) -> *mut u8; 104 | fn as_ffi_void_ptr(&mut self) -> *mut c_void { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `-D dead-code` implied by `-D warnings` = help: to override `-D warnings` add `#[allow(dead_code)]`
error: associated function `from_ptr_mut` is never used ```
and https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/dawn-android-arm-deps-rel/12725/overview
``` [10213/54252] RUST local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/armv7-linux-androideabi/lib/libstd_std.rlib FAILED: local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/armv7-linux-androideabi/lib/libstd_std.rlib "python3" "../../build/rust/rustc_wrapper.py" --rustc=../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/rustc --d...(too long) error: `futex_condvar::Condvar::new` is not yet stable as a const fn --> ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/sync/condvar.rs:127:26 | 127 | Condvar { inner: sys::Condvar::new() } | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = help: const-stable functions can only call other const-stable functions
error: `futex_mutex::Mutex::new` is not yet stable as a const fn ```

entry.title: DeviceSettingsBaseTest.MouseButtonRenaming and MouseKeyCombination flaky on linux-chromeos-rel
entry.content:
Step "interactive_ui_tests on Ubuntu-22.04" failing on builder "chromium/ci/linux-chromeos-rel"
List of failed builders:
Builder: linux-chromeos-rel https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-rel First failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-rel/b8755989722589761809
https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FDeviceSettingsBaseTest.MouseButtonRenaming?q=VHASH%3A20a2c784dc9ab2cb https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FDeviceSettingsBaseTest.MouseKeyCombination?q=VHASH%3A20a2c784dc9ab2cb
